message_1: If $p$ is a prime number and $a$ is any positive integer less than $p$, then what is the remainder when $a^{p-1}$ is divided by $p$?
message_2: According to Fermat's Little Theorem, if $p$ is a prime number and $a$ is an integer not divisible by $p$, then $a^{p-1} \equiv 1 \pmod{p}$. In other words, the remainder when $a^{p-1}$ is divided by $p$ is 1.
